did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Hohstadt Family papers, 1893-1944
did.abstract: Cattle ranchers and mine operators from Douglas, Arizona; ventures in Arizona, New Mexico, and Sonora, Mexico. Companies include Corona Mining Company, Hohstadt Group, and Progress Mining Company. Mexican ranches include La Pera, Batana, Guepare, and Turicachi

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Hohstadt Family papers(MS 150).Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Cattle ranchers and mine operators from Douglas, Arizona; ventures in Arizona, New Mexico, and Sonora, Mexico. Companies include Corona Mining Company, Hohstadt Group, and Progress Mining Company. Mexican ranches include La Pera, Batana, Guepare, and Turicachi.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into three series.

list.item: Series I: Mexican Properties (Arizpe District, Sonora), 1893-1940
Series II: Progress Mining Company and Miscellaneous Material, 1916-1944
Series III: John F. Hohstadt Financial Records, 1900-1929

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection of correspondence and legal papers, including original deeds. Financial records relate chiefly to the ranching and mining activities of John F. Hohstadt, and his brother, Lewis A. Hohstadt. One file contains papers of Robert A. Hohstadt, Lewis A.'s son. Other materials are claims through the U.S. government against the Mexican government by Lewis A. Hohstadt, for losses caused by the Mexican Revolution and agrarian land reforms. Obituaries for both brothers are present.

item.corpname: Corona Mining Company -- Records and correspondence
Progress Mining Co. -- Records and correspondence

item.subject: Mining corporations -- Mexico -- Sonora (State) -- Records and correspondence
Ranches -- Mexico -- Sonora (State) -- Records and correspondence
Mining corporations -- New Mexico -- Records and correspondence

did.unittitle: Series I: Mexican Properties (Arizpe District, Sonora), 1893-1940
Mines: Corona Mining Company (includes plans and deeds). 1893-1904
Mines: Hohstadt Group (includes surveys, assay reports, and bills for supplies). 1906-1928
Ranches (includes titles, livestock records, bills for supplies, land rental - relating to La Pera, Batana, Guepare and Turicachi Ranches). 1899-1939
Ranches: Legal Matters (includes correspondence and legal papers relating to succession of estate of John F. Hohstadt, claims against the government for expropriation, and sale of land). 1931-1939

Ranches: Legal Matters (includes claims through the U. S. government against the Mexican government by Lewis A. Hohstadt regarding losses due to the Mexican Revolution and agrarian reforms). 1924-1940
Mines and Ranches: Taxes and valuations. 1915-1935
Mines and Ranches: Account books. 1915, 1922, 1924, 1927-1929
Series II: Progress Mining Company and Miscellaneous Material, 1916-1944
Progress Mining Company: Mine claims, articles of incorporation. 1916
Progress Mining Company: Annual reports, sale of stock, work reports. 1917-1922
Progress Mining Company: Dissolution, New Mexico property taxes. 1923-1943
Lewis A. Hohstadt Financial Records (includes property taxes, bank statements and checks). 1917-1944
John F. Hohstadt Estate (see also Box 1, Folder 4). 1929 (Death)

John F. Hohstadt: Correspondence (includes correspondence with E. B. Perrin of Williams, Arizona concerning loans and promissory notes, J. F. B. Erdletz of New York concerning Mexican mine situation and proposal for Discovery Mining and Development, Co.). 1912-1923
John and Lewis Hohstadt: Miscellaneous.
Robert A. Hohstadt: Miscellaneous (includes bank records, personal letter of Frank Hohstadt). 1929-1944
Series III: John F. Hohstadt Financial Records, 1900-1929
Financial Records: Bank statements from Bank of Bisbee and First National Bank of Douglas. 1901-1929
Financial Records: Checks (includes some stubs, deposit slips and promissory notes). 1900-1929
Series I: Mexican Properties (Arizpe District, Sonora) - Continued, 1893-1940
Mexican Mine Deeds (oversize). 1898-1900
